info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 3 at 11:29PM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
At 1129 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thorp to 6 miles northwest of Greenwood to 7 miles northeast of Neillsville to 9 miles southwest of Babcock. Movement was southeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Babcock around 1145 PM CDT. Pittsville around 1150 PM CDT. Marshfield and Spencer around 1200 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wood County Park, Big Eau Pleine County Park, Moon, Fenwood, Powers Bluff County Park, Hogarty, Bethel, Knowlton, Ringle, and Glandon.
This line of storms has produced frequent lightning and torrential rainfall of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Monitor the weather for any futures statements or possible warnings on this line of thunderstorms.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN WOOD AND MARATHON COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM CDT
